# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

# Answer

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[ -]" => "_")
end
```
This function takes a string `col` as input, and returns the cleaned column name. It uses the `replace` function to replace any spaces or hyphens with an underscore, and then applies the `lowercase` function to convert the resulting string to lowercase. Finally, it uses the `strip` function to remove any leading or trailing whitespaces from the result.

Note that this function assumes that all column names are strings, and it will not work if the input is a vector of column names. If you need to clean multiple columns at once, you can use the `replace` function in combination with `map` to apply the same operation to each element of the array.
